result.execSummary:
The defendant Willie J Winfrey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus DNA surcharge and all other costs and surcharges during the period of probation; civil judgment if not paid.
Pay supervision fees.
No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie J Winfrey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie J Winfrey in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Willie J Winfrey in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Plea hearing proceeded..

  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
.
Parties are proceeding to sentencing.
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 16 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus DNA surcharge and all other costs and surcharges during the period of probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Willie J Winfrey in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 36 on 09/23/2015 at 8:30am.  State rescinded their offer.
Final pre-trial on August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie J Winfrey NOT in court appearance waived with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called at request of branch 36. Matter set for Jury Trial on 8/10/2015. Branch 36 not in session that day, case is Jury Trial date is vacated and adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 36.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie J Winfrey in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a DPA Hearing. DPA not being offered in this case. Defense counsel requests matter be set for a Jury Trial date.  Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Case adjourned for Jury Trial.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie J Winfrey in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties working toward resolution of this matter with a DPA. Case adjourned for a DPA Hearing in branch 23.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MARY T.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Willie J Winfrey in court with attorney Kathleen Judith Osvat.  Defendant Willie J Winfrey in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
